byline.contributor: Richard Fausset contributed reporting from Dothan, Ala.

abstract: Federal Judge Callie V S Granade rules that local probate Judge Don Davis of Mobile County, Ala, cannot refuse to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, repeating previous assertion that ban on such marriages is unconstitutional; ruling potentially clarifies dispute after Roy S Moore, chief justice of state's Supreme Court, insisted that previous ruling from Granade did not apply to probate judges.
lead_paragraph: The decision was expected to send a signal to judges statewide who are caught between a federal ruling and an order from Alabama’s chief justice.

headline.main: U.S. Orders Alabama to License Gay Unions
headline.print_headline: U.S. Orders Alabama to License Gay Unions

snippet: The decision was expected to send a signal to judges statewide who are caught between a federal ruling and an order from Alabama’s chief justice.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
